column5: so yesterday was a bust but thought I would try to get out today a bunch of other people said they were going out today and we would look for each other I unloaded the skidoo and headed for the lake, saw no one called on the radio, heard no one, cheap radios I looked around but everyone looks the same out there and I really don't see much under the helmet so I find a spot catch a few but decide to move about then some snowmobile come running right up to my hut oh, it's Joey and Paul I suggest we move we set up Paul cuts some holes He gets one right away I managed to get into them too, I won't say how deep we were fishing, it's a secret...LOL OH wait that was from the first spot I was fishing, we fished in 19ft everyone in the end caught a bunch of perch I caught a nice pike on 2lb test line still don't know how I got it in great day on the water, thanks for the company sorry I couldn't find any of the other guys out there
Good work Terry i wish i had gone out today. The day was much warmer. I'll be out there next weekend looking for a better day out on the ice
Nice to see you found the fish and some good company to enjoy it with! Thanks Terry. It was a beautiful day here too, Fern and I got out on the sleds for a few hours, had a blast.
Looks like a great day!  Beats yesterday weather-wise!
Thanks for the report and pics.
I see you had some GREAT company bud. Nice sunny day, and you all got some fish. What could be better.

Just a super day Terry.  We just ate our perch and it was delicious.  Thanks again for the Pike.  I have special plans for that.  Are you sure Paul caught perch, didn't you give him that one to hold  Joey
Good to see you guys out on the ice together.  Who's Grand Touring is that and what year?  Looks like mine (2002) but different colour.
mine is a 2004 legend  which is basically the same they didn't make a grand touring that year
oh, I see.  Looks like a great rig you have there Terry.
Wish I had made it looked like fun
Great stuff Terry. So the sled is working well and good to go? Mine's a '98 Grand Touring 500... only has 600 miles on it.

So, I see a power auger on that sled...and you guys made Tybo manually drill them all??? LOL.  Great report Terry...hope to see you out there again for the Tyler event!  Hope my first fish this year is bigger than last year...LOL.
man perch fillets. its 6.30 am and all i can think of is perch mmm.
